intro: Heterosmilax yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan false spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on terminal spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
